game

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Manager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class Manager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Manager Class determines the the behavior of the Trucks. In addition to having a getGame() method, other getters are available for ease of use.

    As the Manager Class is abstract, it is up to the user to extend it and define its behavior, which ultimately is the way the user plays the game.

    The run() method determines what the Manager "does" when the game begins and while it is going on. As the getTrucks() method is available, the run() method is how the Manager communicates with Trucks of its own volition.
    The truckNotification(Truck, int) method is called by Trucks whenever one of many situations occurs, and is how Trucks communicate with the Manager, how the Manager can give instructions in reponse to a change in the Truck's situation.
    Author:
    MPatashnik

      • truckNotification

        public abstract void truckNotification(Truck t,
                     Manager.Notification message)
        Allows Trucks to notify the manager that something has occurred. Notifications may be sent even if the game has not yet started, so consider filtering calls based on game.isRunning().
        See Also:
        The notification enum for types of messages
